data.title: Great food and service
data.text:
I've been to Arabesque a number of times, and have always had a very pleasant experience. The staff has always been super friendly, never had any of the negative experiences that other people mentioned about the owner being rude or service unprofessional, but I also don't doubt the possibility of bad service. I like to get the sampler dishes, and their portions are pretty decently sized so I sometimes split with the person I'm with. I always get the baklava (it's sooo good!) Last time I went, our server seemed a little put off that we were splitting one dish between two people, but didn't say anything about it. I was a bit sad that they didn't have the lovely flavored water that they had always had. I think they used to flavor it with jasmine, or some floral essence like that, but the last time I went it was just regular water. Not a huge deal, of course.

I can see how people might get confused in terms of ordering, because they don't have menus at the tables, and the only menu is inside on a large chalkboard. The staff usually explains the menu items, but it's still a bit of an inconvenience.

The overall ambiance of the place is lovely, it's a smaller restaurant tucked away right off Pearl, and really nice to sit outside in warm weather. 

I'll definitely keep coming back, but hope that they can still improve on some points!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Great food from this hidden gem or a restaurant. Definitely worth the time to search it out. I had chicken and potatoes poached in olive oil and spices with a yogurt sauce. I'm still thinking about how good it is days later.

data.title: What a nice surprise!
data.text: A co-worker suggested this place for lunch, and I was blown away. I had an amazing chicken special with pomegranate seeds that was to die for. The iced tea was top notch. Everything on the menu is homemade, and with love. Great place to stop.

data.title: Very Good Mediterranean Fare and Affordable
data.text: This was our 2nd visit and made it a point to return on our recent visit to Boulder. The sampler platter of baba ganoush, hummus, stuffed grape leaves, fatoosh and pita are fresh and tasty. The iced tea contains fresh blueberries, sliced strawberries and orange and lemon slices. We capped off lunch with a unique and tasty (not overly sweet) baklava. Kudos to the owner and friendly staff.

data.title: why just lunch?
data.text:
The food here is excellent, authentically middle eastern and fresh. the ambiance is great! Service is interesting but what great food!
This begs to answer the question "why just lunch!"
With a liquor license and dinner--this place could be magical!

data.title: Delicious Food, Rude Owner
data.text: I've eaten at Arabesque several times. The food and flavors are delicious. But the owner/cook is horrendous. Rude and condescending, Seinfeld's "Soup Nazi" on steroids. I arrived with friends around 11:45 a.m. and we waited close to 30 minutes to place our order. The owner claimed her help hadn't yet arrived. When she took our order, she neither welcomed us or smiled. With her attitude, my only guess is that she is unable to keep good help. Two patrons next to us waited a long time, too. When they went inside to get a small pitcher of water and 2 glasses, the owner came out and berated them in front of everyone. Disappointing, as there is no other food like it in Boulder.

data.title: Mixed review: Good food, spotty service
data.text: I've been here four or five times for lunch. The food has always been a good value for the $ (sampler platters). The service is at times good, and at times terrible and strange. But I will continue to go here, it's a nice place to sit outside and people watch.

data.title: OK sampler
data.text:
We had a chicken sampler, which consists of hummus, baba ganoush and chicken shawarma. The food was OK, nothing that would blow me away, but decent enough.
I was not really impressed by the waiter, we wanted him to explain the menu, but it looked like he had one too many smokes and all we got was "the food is awesome here".

Also did not care for their rose water.

data.title: Delicious authentic Mediterranean food.
data.text: Such delicious food! I especially love shawarma, so  the shawarma plate  was a match.  Loved the babaganoush and humus under the greens, just right for a lunch. Service was so friendly and although we sat inside, with all the good food smells, the outside courtyard is delightful.  This small eatery fills up fast, and closes early.

data.title: Hidden Treasure in Boulder
data.text: My husband and I tried Arabesque for a quick lunch. I had seen some reviews but never been - it's a bit hidden, so I had never seen it before. We were very happy with our choice! We both tried the veggie sampler platter, which came with salad, hummus, baba ganoush, tabbouleh, dolmas, and bread. Everything was great! Especially the hummus - I'm not usually a fan of hummus because it can be boring, but theirs was garlicky and delicious. The water served was rose water, which was great! The portion was large for 1 person, so next time I'll just have a regular lunch dish, but we will definitely be back! The server was very attentive and friendly as well.

data.title: Did I mention the Sample Platter?
data.text:
Took a friend to lunch at my treasured restaurant in Boulder .  We both LOVED what Manal Jarrar (Chef and Owner) cooked for us and Ronya, her daughter, served us.  It was a cold, rainy day (in the 40’s) and the hot Chai was such a treat.  We split the sampler plate and my friend ordered a lentil soup add on addition, but she filled up pretty fast.  All was so delicious that we each got a salad to take home with us.  There are only 8 tables in this highly specialized Palestinian home cooking restaurant for breakfast and lunch, so get there early.  
Flavors were exploding, like being at Grandma's; we felt spoiled.

data.title: Delicious and Friendly
data.text:
So, we got a suggestion from our Airbnb host to come to Arabesque for breakfast. We drove over to downtown Boulder. Don't forget to pay the meter for parking. Found Arabesque and went on in. We were immediately seated by our friendly waitress. The day was cool and rainy, so I ordered a hot chocolate and a quiche. My girlfriend ordered a breakfast wrap. First, the hot chocolate was delicious; amazingly so. It wasn't too sweet, like what one might find out of a package. This tasted like chocolate that was melted and just barely sweetened. It was covered in whipped cream and was a perfect start and finish to the meal. 
My quiche was also deliciously rich and stayed with me (in a good way) for a long time. That is to say, that if you order this and you don't eat much, perhaps you could share with a friend. My girlfriends wrap looked huge, but was surprisingly light and tasty.
I definitely recommend Arabesque. If you are in downtown Boulder and want a delicious breakfast, you can't go wrong here.

data.title: Authentic!!!
data.text:
As soon as you walk in you are transported to the other side of the world. You can smell almost savor true middle eastern food. One of our friends has been here many times and was so right when she said we'd love it!!
With the owner doing the cooking herself, you know you're getting the real deal. 

BTW, the owner recommended we try the Baklava with our coffee (best Baklava I've had so far).

data.title: Great homemade food
data.text:
Went for lunch & had a Shawarma Plate.  Delicious, as usual.  The flavors of the food they serve here virtually explode off the plate.

Service was good and the atmosphere is very homey.  Love the place.  Will continue to return time and time again.

data.title: MIXED: thumbs UP- food, thumbs DOWN- service attitude
data.text: This is a tiny family run place with comfortable indoor seating and lovely outdoor seating.  Why do I come? The food is exceptional - the hummus, the schwarma, spinach pie, baklava, coffee - I've had it all on numerous visits - and the made that day on the premises pita bread tops it all off as the most delicious Palestinian food in Boulder.  Why do I not go more often?  The owner is intimidating - I wish it wasn't so, but I have to be in the right frame of mind to stand up to her in order to eat her exceptional food.  So, this is a mixed review.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: I wish I lived here so I could eat here everyday. ...like my sister's going to do!  I had the chicken shawarma plate and carrot juice and I almost licked the plate clean.

data.title: Hidden Gem Downtown Boulder!
data.text: My sister and I are Mediterranean and thrilled to find Arabesque at the recommendation of our friends. Come early, come often - try the combo plate and secret recipe Chai. DELICIOUS!

data.title: delicious homemade food!
data.text: this is a family run small restaurant that served up fresh authentic palestinian food. lots of vegan options. relaxed atmosphere, good portions at good prices. highly recommended

data.title: Healthy and Delecious
data.text: I came across this delightful food restaurant at noon. I have had lots of Mideastern food before but this one was exotic. Their food is really tasty just like home cookiing. I would love to visit again.

data.title: Authentic, delicious food and genuine service
data.text: Wonderful home cooking, fresh ingredients, dynamic flavors. And the owner is authentic and caring. Of course, with home-cooked meals and fresh foods like made-from-scratch hummus and baba ganoush, eating at Arabesque is like eating in a genuine home kitchen in the Middle East. And I suppose the service is the same; if you're in a private kitchen and you appreciate and respect the cook, you'll be treated accordingly (extremely well!). As for the reviewers who comment on the owner being something other than perfectly nice, I can only presume that they brought it upon themselves. The customer is not always right when you are in someone's personal kitchen!
